p: The safety of sandalwood oil is an important consideration. While routine allergy studies have found that only 0.1 to 2.4% of tested patients were allergic to the oil, many did not report the quality, purity or origin of the oil, which could have influenced the test results. For example, West Australian ( Santalum spicatum) or Hawaiian ( Santalum paniculatum) oil contains significant amounts of farnesol [ 11], which is listed as an irritant in Annex III of the EU Cosmetics Regulation [ 24]. However, this is not present in Santalum album oil.
